results.justification: The document clearly states the study's purpose and overall approach throughout sections 3.1-3.5.
Sections 3.1 through 3.5 provide a detailed, step-by-step description of the experimental design, including participant recruitment, task design, data collection, and data analysis.
The document does not state whether the raw or processed datasets are publicly available. There is no mention of data sharing or justification for its absence.

The document mentions an 'Appendix at this link' for the complete action and process libraries (Table 1), which could be considered partial data documentation. However, the link is not functional within the provided text.

Data collection methods are fully described in sections 3.2 and 3.3, detailing questionnaires, prior knowledge tests, trace data collection (navigation logs, mouse activity, keyboard inputs), and the coding process.
The document does not mention whether the analysis code is shared in a repository.
Since the code is not shared, there is no information about scripts for data cleaning, analysis, or visualization.

Statistical tests (Wilcoxon rank-sum test), effect sizes (Pearson’s 𝑟), and p-values are reported in section 4.1 and 4.2. Ordered Network Analysis (ONA) and Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) are also described.
The analysis primarily focuses on quantitative methods. While there is some interpretation of the results, there is no explicit mention of qualitative data coding or analysis.
The outcomes of the experiment are shared in section 4.1 and 4.2, detailing the effects of GenAI scaffolding on SRL and learner reactions to the scaffolds.
Section 4.3 discusses several limitations of the study, including the contextual nature of the prompt design, learner non-compliance, and sample size issues.
